file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 35-10-09-04 - CREW-MASK STOWAGE BOX - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL CREW-MASK STOWAGE BOX - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the pilot/copilot mask stowage box and observer mask stowage top. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY CREW-MASK STOWAGE BOX - REMOV- ALL 35-10-09-000-801-A AL CREW-MASK STOWAGE BOX - INSTAL- ALL 35-10-09-400-801-A LATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 35-10-09 Page 1 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 35-10-09-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. CREW-MASK STOWAGE BOX - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedure for the removal of the pilot/copilot mask stowage box and observer mask stowage top. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-03/100 - COMPONENT LOCATION AMM TASK 35-10-00-910-801-A/200 - AMM TASK 35-10-00-910-803-A/200 - AMM TASK 35-10-10-000-801-A/400 CREW OXYGEN MASK - REMOVAL SB145-25-0072 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 232 224PZ Attendant's wardrobe 224 224QZ Cockpit D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Cockpit/Attendant's wardrobe I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Obey the safety precautions (AMM TASK 35-10-00-910-801-A/200) and general instructions (AMM TASK 35-10-00-910-803-A/200). (2) Remove access panel 224PZ for aircraft PRE-MOD SB145-25-0072 or 224QZ for aircraft POST-MOD SB 145-25-0072 ( AMM MPP 06-41-03/100). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 35-10-09 Page 2 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (3) Close the cylinder pressure regulator (1). J. Removal (Figure 401) (Figure 402) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) (FOR RADIO CONNECTOR ASSEMBLED TO THE STOWAGE BOX) Removal of the pilot/copilot mask stowage box: (a) Loosen the Dzus fasteners (4). (b) Pull the pilot/copilot mask stowage box (5) up to get access to its bottom. (c) Pull the oxygen mask fully out from the stowage box (5). Refer to AMM TASK 35-10-10-000-801-A/400. (d) Loosen the nut (6) to remove the nylon washers (7, 8 and 9) and the radio connector. NOTE: When you remove the oxygen box to do an overhaul, or when you remove the oxygen box to change or do a test of the radio connector, do not remove the radio connector from the oxygen box. You must remove (or unsolder, as applicable) the wire from the radio connector. WARNING:OPEN THE OXYGEN FITTINGS SLOWLY TO PREVENT TEMPERATURES TOO HIGH . (e) Disconnect the hose fitting (10). NOTE: A small quantity of oxygen can flow out when you disconnect the related fitting. (2) (FOR RADIO CONNECTOR INSTALLED WITH QUICK DISCONNECT PLUG) Removal of the pilot/copilot mask stowage box: (a) Loosen the Dzus fasteners (4). (b) Pull the pilot/copilot stowage box (5) up to get access to its bottom. (c) Disconnect the plug (6) from the radio connector. WARNING: OPEN THE OXYGEN FITTINGS SLOWLY TO PREVENT TOO HIGH TEMPERATURES. (d) Disconnect the hose fitting (7). NOTE: A small quantity of oxygen can flow out when you disconnect the related fitting. (3) Removal of the observer mask stowage top: (a) Loosen the Dzus fasteners (3). (b) Remove the observer mask stowage top (2). AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 35-10-09-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. CREW-MASK STOWAGE BOX - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedure for the installation of the pilot/copilot mask stowage box and observer mask stowage top. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-03/100 - COMPONENT LOCATION AMM TASK 35-10-00-700-801-A/500 CREW OXYGEN MASK - OPERATIONAL CHECK AMM TASK 35-10-00-910-801-A/200 - AMM TASK 35-10-00-910-803-A/200 - AMM TASK 35-10-00-910-805-A/200 - AMM TASK 35-10-10-400-801-A/400 CREW OXYGEN MASK - INSTALLATION SB145-25-0072 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 232 224PZ Attendant's wardrobe 224 224QZ Cockpit D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Torque wrench To measure the torque available E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Cockpit/Attendant's wardrobe EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 35-10-09 Page 6 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Installation (Figure 401) (Figure 402) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Obey the safety precautions (AMM TASK 35-10-00-910-801-A/200) and general instructions (AMM TASK 35-10-00-910-803-A/200). (2) (FOR RADIO CONNECTOR ASSEMBLED TO THE STOWAGE BOX) Installation of the pilot/copilot mask stowage box: (a) Connect the hose fitting (10) and tighten it to the torque given in (Figure 401). (b) Do a check for leaks at the hose fitting (10). Refer to AMM TASK 35-10-00-910-805-A/200. (c) If you removed the radio connector: 1 Install the nylon washers (7, 8 and 9) and the radio connector and tighten the nut (6). (d) If you removed the wire from the radio connector: 1 Install (or solder, as applicable) the wire back to the radio connector. (e) Put the oxygen mask into the stowage box (5). Refer to AMM TASK 35-10-10-400-801-A/400. (f) Fit the pilot/copilot mask stowage box (5) into the lateral console. (g) Tighten the Dzus fasteners (4). (3) (FOR RADIO CONNECTOR INSTALLED WITH QUICK DISCONNECT PLUG) Installation of the pilot/copilot mask stowage box: (a) Connect the hose fitting (7) and tighten it to the torque given in (Figure 402). (b) Do a check for leaks at the hose fitting (7). Refer to AMM TASK 35-10-00-910-805-A/200. (c) Connect the plug (6) to the radio connector. (d) Fit the pilot/copilot mask stowage box (5) into the lateral console. (e) Tighten the Dzus fasteners (4). (4) Installation of the observer mask stowage top: (a) Fit the observer mask stowage top (2) into the RH aft console. (b) Tighten the Dzus fasteners (3). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Do the operational check ( AMM TASK 35-10-00-700-801-A/500). (2) Make sure that the cylinder pressure regulator (1) is in the "OPEN" position. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 35-10-09 Page 7 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (3) Install the access panel 224PZ for aircraft PRE-MOD SB145-25-0072 or 224QZ for aircraft POST-MOD SB 145-25-0072 ( AMM MPP 06-41-03/100). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 35-10-09 Page 8 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
